channel.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
channel.description:
Hey all, I'd like to find any and all uncommon dupes and hacks I should be aware about with my server. I've been playing another server and there whole community is screwed because of unexplained dupes So if you can post them here or even if it's a theory then please do.
Regards Brent

item.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

if(!playerhasItem(itemId, amount)
return;

cheap fix for ya.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

All you need is, as stated before, validate input on the server side, an to discourage any future changes.

What I mean by this is, as suggested by MITB, have the player change their inventory to have 1000 partyhats. When the player tries to force the items into the server (with a bank deposit, dropping the item, etc), the server notices the discrepancy, and rejects the packet. However, you can also resend the player’s inventory data so that all of the changes that were made client side, are reverted.

Now, with programs like CheatEngine, one can freeze the space in memory, so that even if the server resends the true inventory data, CheatEngine will reject the changes, so that it still shows as 1000 partyhats. This still will not make any impact on the server, due to the validation.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I thought you might have been trying to be sarcastic and saying that you can duplicate items client-side, and you can’t. No debate then.

No, not at all haha. I’ve noticed that most of the disagreements I have with users on this forum is because of miscommunication. Eventually they all get straightened out though.

EDIT: I just now noticed that this is in the Client section, lol!

Read full topic

item.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:428034”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530727.msg3876165#msg3876165 date=1325694688]

If there was an issue, I don’t know why you wouldn’t explain how it is done so people can take measures to fix it.

It isn’t an issue. I’m not even sure of the fix.

The fix is always checking input on the server side.

Of course since nothing can be duped client-sided.
[/quote]

What are you saying? You can make the client show you whatever you want, like you have 1000 party hats, but if the server does what it should and checks input, you can’t do anything with them because they don’t exist on the server.[/quote]

I know this. That’s exactly what I’m saying. That’s not item duplication because like you said, they don’t exist. Maybe you classify that as duplication, but I wouldn’t. I’m going to stop debating these topics with you, I’ve got to do some things. We can continue this discussion elsewhere if you like though.

Read full topic

It isn’t an issue. I’m not even sure of the fix.

The fix is always checking input on the server side.
[/quote]

Of course since nothing can be duped client-sided.[/quote]

What are you saying? You can make the client show you whatever you want, like you have 1000 party hats, but if the server does what it should and checks input, you can’t do anything with them because they don’t exist on the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Uncommon Hacks/Dupes I should fix?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:428034”][quote author=Team_Rocket link=topic=530727.msg3876020#msg3876020 date=1325688883]

If there was an issue, I don’t know why you wouldn’t explain how it is done so people can take measures to fix it.

It isn’t an issue. I’m not even sure of the fix.
[/quote]

The fix is always checking input on the server side.[/quote]

Of course since nothing can be duped client-sided.

@OP
If I were you I’d fix all the common dupes, host a open-Alpha stage, closed-Beta, and finally open-Beta. Odds are you’ll have squashed most of the dupes by then. Don’t make the stages go so fast that they’re a joke either. Also, just because you’re in an open-Beta, that doesn’t mean that all of the accounts should be reset after you finish it.

Read full topic
